thread.title: Emmanuel Adebayor was 'very lazy' and used to eat muffins in the gym, reveals Brede Hangeland
thread.title_full: Emmanuel Adebayor was 'very lazy' and used to eat muffins in the gym, reveals Brede Hangeland

author: Jack Rathborn
title: Emmanuel Adebayor was 'very lazy' and used to eat muffins in the gym, reveals Brede Hangeland
text:
Emmanuel Adebayor was 'very lazy' and used to eat muffins in the gym, reveals Brede Hangeland The Norwegian defender also claims the Togan striker would switch off during games because he was 'hungry' Share Emmanuel Adebayor allegedly used to snack on muffins during gym sessions, claims Brede Hangeland (Photo: Reuters / Eddie Keogh) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Revelations that Emanuel Adebayor was 'very lazy' might not surprise many, but scoffing muffins during gym sessions certainly raises eyebrows if former Crystal Palace teammate Brede Hangeland is to be believed. 
The Norwegian defender is good for a story or two and has lifted the lid on one of the most controversial players in recent memory. 
Strength sessions can be tough going but the Togan forward's ritual is most certainly different to that you would usually associate with a Premier League player. 
“When we had strength workouts he would sit in the gym with just a cup of coffee and a muffin," Hangeland told radio station Heia fotball. Adebayor has been playing for Togo in the Africa Cup of Nations (Photo: AFP) Read More Emmanuel Adebayor struggles for Togo as DR Congo secure AFCON Group C top spot with 3-1 win 
“He was being paid by [Manchester] City, Tottenham and Palace at the same time, and he was sitting in the gym drinking coffee. Incredible natural talent, but very lazy.” 
If that wasn't enough evidence of Adebayor's eccentric behaviour, imagine being distracted during a game because you were hungry. Adebayor's gym snack was allegedly a muffin during his time at Palace (Photo: Alex Livesey) Read More Arsenal "are just Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez" declares former Gunners striker Emmanuel Adebayor 
“I only played with him for six months but here's a quick story. I was playing for Fulham and he played for Spurs," remembered Hangeland. 
“We were attacking and I was marking Adebayor in the midfield. He suddenly he said, 'Ahhh, I'm hungry.' I replied, 'What?' 
“I can't wait for the game to finish, I'm so hungry,' he said. Do you know a good restaurant in London, Hangeland?” poll loading Will Emmanuel Adebayor ever play in the Premier League again? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
